title: Listed buildings in Pudsey
text: <a href="Pudsey%20%28ward%29">Pudsey</a> is a <a href="Ward%20%28electoral%20subdivision%29">ward</a> in the <a href="metropolitan%20borough">metropolitan borough</a> of the <a href="City%20of%20Leeds">City of Leeds</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England. It contains 47 <a href="Listed%20building%23England%20and%20Wales">listed buildings</a> that are recorded in the <a href="National%20Heritage%20List%20for%20England">National Heritage List for England</a>. Of these, one is listed at Grade I, the highest of the three grades, two are at Grade II*, the middle grade, and the others are at Grade II, the lowest grade. The parish contains the town of <a href="Pudsey">Pudsey</a>, including the area of <a href="Swinnow">Swinnow</a>, and the countryside to the southwest, including the village of <a href="Tyersal">Tyersal</a>. It also contains the <a href="Fulneck%20Moravian%20Settlement">Fulneck Moravian Settlement</a>, many of whose buildings are listed. Most of the other listed buildings are houses, cottages, and associated structures, farmhouses and farm buildings, a milestone, public houses, some of which have been converted for other uses, former schools, churches, a bank, and a war memorial.
